prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Stanislaw J. Makielski Papers, 1915-1957, Accession # 10768-d, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This addition was given to the University of Virginia Library by Alice Makielski, Charlottesville, Virginia, on April 26, 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: These additional papers of Charlottesville architect, Stanislaw J. Makielski, consists of ca. 30 items, ca. 1915-1957, n.d., chiefly architectural drawings for his own residence in Charlottesville, Virginia; a photograph album of family portraits and World War I service; a small notebook containing "Memoirs of My Trip to Rome," kept by Lt. Stanislaw J. Makielski on his leave to Rome, March 5 through March 20, 1919, and a few pages about his embarkation on April 4, 1919, for his return trip home via New York on the S.S. Suriname. Also present are several army passes and orders, and a few souvenirs of his trip.
